Relevance to Condition: Studies have found lower MPV and PDW values in patients with incarcerated hernias compared to those undergoing elective hernia repair.

Relevance to Condition: Anemia has been associated with hiatal hernias, especially when there's no other obvious source of blood loss. Management of the hernia has been shown to improve anemia in such cases.

Description: A measure of the variation in red blood cell size.

Description: A higher number of eosinophils, a type of white blood cell involved in allergic responses and asthma.

Description: An increased number of white blood cells, typically indicating an inflammatory or immune response.
